greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of cyclic subgroups of the group SL(2, Z(n)), counting conjugates as distinct.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
example: Case n=2: generators of the 5 cyclic groups are:
program: (GAP) Concatenation([1], List([2..10], n->Sum( Filtered( ConjugacyClassesSubgroups( SL(2, Integers mod n)), x->IsCyclic( Representative(x))), Size)));
MatOrder(M)={my(id=matid(#M), k=1, N=M); while(N<>id, k++;N=N*M); k}
a(n)={sum(a=0, n-1, sum(b=0, n-1, sum(c=0, n-1, sum(d=0, n-1, my(M=Mod([a, b; c, d], n)); if(matdet(M)==1, 1/eulerphi(MatOrder(M)))))))}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 06 2018
